bug.short_desc: Table scroller's "beforeSort" does not allow preventing default action

long_desc.thetext: Although the code in Scroller.js looks at the fireDataEvent() return value to determine whether it should proceed with a default action, it does not set the event to cancelable which disallows calling e.getPreventDefault().

Derrell, AFAIK the (standard) behavior is the same as in the old bugzilla: you have to assign explicitly to a user via his/her email address. Then setting the status to ASSIGNED (from NEW) means "accepted", i.e. the assignee accepted to work on it. HTH.
